title: Spicy Swiss Chard Soba Noodles
ingredients: sesame seeds or crushed peanuts (for garnish)
directions: Bring a pot of water (for the noodles) to a boil. /p Wash the Swiss Chard leaves. Cut the leafy bits of the chard away from the stem. Shred the leaves into bit size pieces, and slice the stems like you would celery. /p Mix the sauce ingredients (soy sauce, maple syrup, chili paste) into a small bowl. /p Heat a wok or skillet over high heat with sesame oil. Add the onions and the chard stems. /p  Drop the noodles into the boiling water. Remember that soba noodles cook quickly (usually about 4 minutes) so make sure everything else is ready before you do this. /p Stir the onions and char stems for 2-3 minutes, then add garlic and shredded leaves. Cook for 1 more minute, stirring frequently. /p Quickly drain the noodles and add them to the main with the chard, then pour the sauce over the top. /p Stir to coat everything, cook for another minute or two to warm through. Serve sprinkled with chopped nuts or sesame seeds.  /p Serving Size: ½ of total yield /p Calories 447
